limit.description: The maximum number of records to retrieve

offset.description: The number of records to skip before starting to retrieve data

query.description: The query string used to filter the results

functionality: Retrieve account records
example_code:
import requests
url = 'https://instance.servicenow.com/api/now/account'
params = {'limit': {limit}, 'offset': {offset}, 'query': {query}}
headers = {'Accept': 'application/json'}
response = requests.get(url, params=params, headers=headers)
data = response.json()
print(data)

api_call: servicenow.retrieve_activities(before={before}, context={context}, context_instance={context_instance}, end_date={end_date}, facets={facets}, last={last}, record_id={record_id}, start_date={start_date}, stFrom={stFrom})

before.description: Date/time value. The request returns only records created prior to this date and time.

context.description: Required. Sys_id of an activity context. Located in the Activity Context [sn_actsub_activity_context] table. Predefined activity contexts include Consumer and Contact.

context_instance.description: Required. Sys_id of an instance of the specified activity context, representing the initiator of the activities you want to retrieve. Located in the appropriate table for the activity context.

end_date.description: Date/time value. The request returns only records created during the time period defined by start_date and this parameter. Must be set along with start_date.

facets.description: Comma-separated list of sys_ids of activity facet types to retrieve for the specified activity context. These sys_ids are located in the Activity Facet [sn_actsub_facet] table. Default: Return all activity facet types configured for the activity context.

last.description: Index value of the first result row omitted from the response body. The result row index starts at 0. Default: The value of the com.snc.actsub.activities.api.fetch.limit system property (10 by default).

record_id.description: Sys_id of a record to use when rendering dynamic facets. Located in the appropriate table for the activity type you want to retrieve.

start_date.description: Date/time value. The request returns only records created during the time period defined by this parameter and end_date. Must be set along with end_date.

stFrom.description: Index value of the first result row to include in the response body. The result row index starts at 0. Default: 0.

functionality: Stops a background check.

By providing the request ID, users can terminate the execution of the background check.

functionality: Gets status of the request with the given ID.

meta_data.description: This API endpoint retrieves the status of a request identified by the provided request ID. It is used to check the progress or completion status of a background check request that was initiated using the POST /agents/check_defs/{check_def_id}/run API. The API returns the current status of the request, which can be one of several values including 'done', 'failure', 'mid_flow', 'processing', or 'timeout'. Additionally, an error message may be provided if there was an issue processing the request.

The API returns the current status of the test check, which can be one of several values including 'Pending', 'In progress', 'Complete', or 'No test result with given ID'. check_id.description: Sys_id of a policy check sandbox copy in the Check Instances [sn_agent_check] table.

active.description: Flag that indicates whether the policy check is active.

auto_generate.description: Flag that indicates whether to automatically generate the command with the command_prefix value.

check_type.description: Check type specifying the monitoring option.

command_prefix.description: If the auto_generate property is true, this command is used for automatic generation.

event_status_change_threshold.description: The number of consecutive times that a check's response status must happen before a new event is sent.

event_status_repair_threshold.description: The number of consecutive times that a check's response status must improve to close the previous event.

interval.description: The amount of time in seconds to wait between check executions.

name.description: Name of the check.

timeout.description: The amount of time, in seconds, after which the check execution stops when no output is returned.

api_call: servicenow.retrieve_alarms(alarmRaisedTime, fields, id, limit, offset, probableCause, state, sourceSystemId)

alarmRaisedTime.description: Date the alarm was raised. Only alarms with a date matching the value of this parameter are returned in the response.

fields.description: List of fields to return in the response. Invalid fields are ignored.

id.description: Alarm ID. Only alarms with an ID matching the value of this parameter are returned in the response.

limit.description: Maximum number of records to return. For requests that exceed this number of records, use the offset parameter to paginate record retrieval.

offset.description: Starting index at which to begin retrieving records. Use this value to paginate record retrieval.

probableCause.description: Probable cause of the alarm. Only alarms with a probable cause matching the value of this parameter are returned in the response.

state.description: Alarm state. Only alarms with a state matching the value of this parameter are returned in the response.

sourceSystemId.description: Source system ID of the alarm. Only alarms with a source system ID matching the value of this parameter are returned in the response.

sysparm_dependent_value.description: Value to select in the Case [sn_customerservice_case] table choice field that the requested field is dependent on. Use only when requesting a choice field that is dependent on another field.

sysparm_limit.description: Maximum number of records to return. Unusually large sysparm_limit values can impact system performance. For requests that exceed this number of records, use the sysparm_offset parameter to paginate record retrieval.

sysparm_offset.description: Starting record index for which to begin retrieving records. Use this value to paginate record retrieval. This functionality enables the retrieval of all records, regardless of the number of records, in small manageable chunks.

sysparm_query.description: Encoded query used to filter the result set. Queries defined using this parameter are appended to any encoded queries produced by reference qualifiers.

sysparm_reference_field_columns.description: Comma-separated list of column names, from the table of the specified reference field, to return in the response.

sysparm_ref_qual_input.description: Encoded set of field values representing a current object to pass to reference qualifiers that use JavaScript functions. Use only when requesting a reference field.

sysparm_display_value.description: Determines the type of data returned, either the actual values from the database or the display values of the fields.

functionality: Retrieve the specified Customer Service Management (CSM) case.

sysparm_offset.description: Starting record index for which to begin retrieving records.

sysparm_query.description: Encoded query used to filter the result set.

account.description: Sys_id of the account associated with the case; located in the Account [customer_account] table.
account.default: If contact specified, defaults to account specified in contact record.

active.description: Flag that indicates whether the case is open and active.

active_account_escalation.description: Sys_id of the active account escalation record associated with the case. Located in the Escalation [sn_customerservice_escalation] table.

active_escalation.description: Sys_id of the active escalation record associated with the case. Located in the Escalation [sn_customerservice_escalation] table.

activity_due.description: Date for which the associated case is expected to be completed.

additional_assignee_list.description: List of the sys_ids of the additional persons (other than the primary assignee) that have been assigned to the account. Located in the User [sys_user] table.

approval.description: String that describes the type of approval required.

assigned_to.description: Sys_id of the person assigned to the case. Located in the User [sys_user] table.

assignment_group.description: Sys_id of the customer service agent group assigned to the case. Located in the Group [sys_user_group] table.

business_duration.description: Length in calendar work hours, work days, and work weeks that it took to complete the case.

business_impact.description: Impact of the issue on the associated customer.

business_service.description: Sys_id of the service record associated with the case. Located in the Service [cmdb_ci_service] table.

cause.description: Details about the cause of the problem.

caused_by.description: Sys_id of the change request that caused the case to be created. Located in the Change Request [change_request] table.

change.description: Sys_id of the change request that caused the case to be created. Located in the Change Request [change_request] table.

child_case_creation_progress.description: Flag that indicates whether the case is a child case that was created from a major case.

close_notes.description: Notes made when the case was closed.

closed_at.description: Date and time that the case was closed.

closed_by.description: Sys_id of the user that closed the case. Located in the User [sys_user] table.

cmdb_ci.description: Sys_id of the configuration item associated with the case. Located in the Configuration Item [cmdb_ci] table.

company.description: Sys_id of the company associated with the case. Located in the Company [core_company] table.

consumer.description: Business-to-consumer cases only. Sys_id of the person to contact with regard to this case. Located in the Consumer [csm_consumer] table.

contact.description: Business-to-business based cases only. Sys_id of the person to contact regarding this case. Located in the Contact [customer_contact] table.

contact_time_zone.description: Time zone of the contact associated with the case.

contact_type.description: Method in which the case was initially reported.

contract.description: Sys_id of the contract associated with the case. Located in the Contract [ast_contract] table.

delivery_plan.description: Sys_id of the parent execution plan for this case. Located in the Execution Plan [sc_cat_item_delivery_plan] table.

delivery_task.description: Sys_id of the execution plan task. Located in the Execution Plan Task [sc_cat_item_delivery_task] table.

description.description: Detailed description of the problem associated with the case.

due_date.description: Date that the case is due to be closed.

entitlement.description: Sys_id of the entitlement record associated with the case. Located in the Entitlement [service_entitlement] table.

expected_start.description: Date and time when work is scheduled to begin on the case.

first_response_time.description: Date and time when the first action was taken on the case.

follow_the_sun.description: Flag that indicates whether the case should be handed-off for global follow-up.

group_list.description: List of sys_ids of the group records associated with the case. Located in the Group [sys_user_group] table.

knowledge.description: Flag that indicates if there is a knowledge base article available for the specified issue.

location.description: Sys_id of the record describing the company location. Located in the Location [cmn_location] table.

made_sla.description: Flag that indicates whether the case was resolved in alignment with the associated service level agreement.

major_case_state.description: Current state of the major case.

notes_to_comments.description: Flag that indicates whether to add the resolution notes to the comments.

notify.description: Method to use to notify contact/consumer.

opened_at.description: Date and time that the case was opened.

opened_by.description: Sys_id of the person that initially opened the case. Located in the User [sys_user] table.

parent.description: Sys_id of the parent case to which this case (child) is associated. Located in the Task [task] table.

partner.description: Sys_id of the partner associated with the case. Located in the Account [customer_account] table.

partner_contact.description: Sys_id of the partner contact associated with the case. Located in the Contact [customer_contact] table.

probable_cause.description: Possible cause of the issue associated with the case.

problem.description: Sys_id of the issue that the customer is encountering. Located in the Problem [problem] table.

product.description: Sys_id of the product model of the asset associated to the case. Located in the Product Model [cmdb_model] table.

reassignment_count.description: Number of times that the case was reassigned to a person that is responsible for moving the case forward.

recipient_list.description: Sys_id of the record that contains the list of recipients for communications about this case. Located in the Recipients List [sn_publications_recipients_list] table.

rejection_goto.description: Sys_id of the task to execute if the case is rejected. Located in the Task [task] table.

resolution_code.description: Resolution state for the case, such as 'Solved - Fixed by Support/Guidance provided'.

resolved_at.description: Date and time that the case was resolved.

resolved_by.description: Sys_id of the person that resolved the case. Located in the User [sys_user] table.

skills.description: List of the unique identifiers (sys_id) of the skills needed to complete the case. Located in the Skill [cmn_skill] table.

sla_due.description: Date/time at which the case must be closed based on the associated service level agreement.

social_channel.description: Type of social media channel such as Twitter, Facebook, or Instagram.

social_handle_type.description: Type of case to associate the social media profile.

social_handle_url.description: URL of the user's social media handle.

social_post_url.description: URL of the social message from which the case is being generated.

state.description: Current state of the case.

support_manager.description: Sys_id of the CSM manager assigned to the case. Located in the User [sys_user] table.

sync_driver.description: Flag that indicates whether there's driver synchronization.

time_worked.description: Total amount of time worked on the case.

upon_approval.description: Action to take if the case is approved.

upon_reject.description: Action to take if the case is rejected.

variables.description: Name-value pairs of variables associated with the case.

watch_list.description: List of sys_ids of the users who receive notifications about this case when additional comments are added or if the state of a case is changed to Resolved or Closed. Located in the User [sys_user] table.

wf_activity.description: Sys_id of the workflow activity record associated with the case. Located in the Workflow Activity [wf_activity] table.

work_end.description: Date and time that work on the case ended.

work_notes_list.description: List of sys_ids of the work notes associated with the case. Located in the Work Note [sn_work_note] table.

work_start.description: Date and time that work on the case began.

api_call: servicenow.create_shared_component_upload(api_version=api_version, shared_library_name=shared_library_name, changeset_number=changeset_number, data_format=data_format, auto_commit=auto_commit, auto_delete=auto_delete, delete_redundant_overrides=delete_redundant_overrides, identifier_keys=identifier_keys, ignore_attributes=ignore_attributes, name_path=name_path, publish_option=publish_option, upload_data=upload_data)
functionality: Enables you to create and manage shared libraries and shared components by uploading configuration data.

api_version.description: Version of the endpoint to access

shared_library_name.description: Name of the shared library to create or manage. Located in the CDM Application [sn_cdm_application] table.

changeset_number.description: String that uniquely identifies the changeset associated with the application, such as Chset-102. Located in the CDM Changeset [sn_cdm_changeset] table. This changeset must be in the 'Open' state.

auto_commit.description: Flag that indicates whether the changeset identified in the changesetNumber parameter is committed to the data model after upload.

auto_delete.description: Flag that indicates whether the existing nodes, that aren’t part of the upload content, are deleted after the processing is complete.

delete_redundant_overrides.description: Flag that indicates whether to create an override where redundant values are present.

identifier_keys.description: List of names that indicate which key in an array child to use to identify the same node.

ignore_attributes.description: Flag that indicates whether the given data format supports attributes (currently only XML).

name_path.description: Path of the targeted node under which the configuration data should be uploaded.

publish_option.description: Publish option for the associated configured snapshots.

upload_data.description: Configuration data to upload. This can be any data in the format defined by the dataFormat parameter of the query parameters.

questions: What happens if the autoCommit parameter is set to true?
Can I upload configuration data in a format other than those listed in dataFormat?
How can I handle errors related to exceeding the maximum upload size?

api_call: servicenow.upload_shared_component_file(api_version=api_version, shared_library_name=shared_library_name, changeset_number=changeset_number, auto_commit=auto_commit, auto_validate=auto_validate, file_name=file_name, file_node_name=file_node_name, name_path=name_path, upload_data=upload_data)
functionality: Uploads files as part of the Configuration Data Model (CDM) under the components folder in a shared library.

api_version.description: Version of the endpoint to access

shared_library_name.description: Name of the shared library where the component to delete is located. Located in the CDM Application [sn_cdm_application] table.

changeset_number.description: String that uniquely identifies the changeset associated with the application, such as Chset-102. This changeset must be in the 'Open' state. Located in the CDM Changeset [sn_cdm_changeset] table.

auto_commit.description: Flag that indicates whether the changeset identified in the changesetNumber parameter is committed to the data model after upload.

auto_validate.description: Flag that indicates whether the snapshots created when committed are validated. Note: This option is only available if the autoCommit parameter is true.

file_name.description: Name of the file to upload. This name can differ from than the actual file name and contain the file extension.

file_node_name.description: Name of the file node. This file name is used in the configuration data when exporting it. This name doesn’t require a file extension nor does it affect the download.

name_path.description: Path of the targeted node under which the configuration data should be uploaded. This path is relative to the components, collection, or deployable folder (depending on the endpoint being called).

questions: What is the maximum file size allowed for upload?
Can I specify a different Content-Type header for the file being uploaded?
How can I handle errors related to missing parameters or exceeding the maximum file size?

functionality: Updates the change request identified by the specified sys_id with the key-value pairs in the request body or URL.

example_code:
curl "https://instance.servicenow.com/api/sn_chg_rest/v1/change/b0dbda5347c12200e0ef563dbb9a718f" \
--request PATCH \
--header "Accept: application/json" \
--header "Content-Type: application/json" \
--data "{\"short_desription\": \"Reboot the server at 6 am\" }" \
--user "username":"password"

functionality: Updates the standard change request identified by the specified sys_id with the parameters in the request body or in the URL.

api_version.description: Version of the endpoint to access. For example, v1 or v2. Only specify this value to use an endpoint version other than the latest.

sys_id.description: Sys_id of the change request to modify. Located in the [change_request] table.

data.description: Name-value pairs representing the field(s) to update in the associated change request. For example, to update the short description file, enter a name-value pair similar to the following: --data '{"short_description": "my short desc" }'.

example_code:
curl "https://instance.servicenow.com/api/sn_chg_rest/v1/change/standard/1c87925347c12200e0ef563dbb9a7177" \
--request PATCH \
--header "Accept: application/json" \
--header "Content-Type: application/json" \
--data "{\"short_description\": \"my short desc\" }" \
--user "username":"password"

functionality: Creates a change request record based on the change request.

chg_model.description: Name of a change model listed in the Change Model [chg_model] table.

type.description: Name of the change request type listed in the Choices [sys_choice] table.

encrypted_fields.description: List of comma-separated fields to encrypt. These fields are encrypted before they are stored in the associated record.

request_body.description: Name-value pairs representing the field(s) to update in the associated change request.

example_code:
curl "https://instance.servicenow.com/api/sn_chg_rest/v1/change" \
--request POST \
--header "Accept:application/json" \
--header "Content-Type:application/json" \
--data "{\n    \"chg_model\" : \"Standard\",\n    \"description\" : \"Describes the change request.\",\n    \"short_description\" : \"My change request\",\n    \"type\" : \"Standard\"\n}" \
--user "username":"password"

api_call: servicenow.create_contact(account, active, agent_status, building, calendar_integration, city, company, cost_center, country, date_format, default_perspective, department, edu_status, email, employee_number, enable_multifactor_authn, failed_attempts, first_name, gender, geolocation_tracked, home_phone, internal_integration_user, introduction, last_login_device, last_login_time, last_name, latitude, ldap_server, location, locked_out, longitude, manager, middle_name, mobile_phone, notification, on_schedule, phone, photo, preferred_language, roles, schedule, social_channel, social_handle, social_handle_url, source, state, street, time_format, time_sheet_policy, time_zone, title, user_name, vip, web_service_access_only, zip)

account.description: Sys_id of the account record to which the contact is associated; Account [customer_account] table.

active.description: Flag that indicates whether the contact is active within the system.

building.description: Sys_id of the record that describes the building in which the contact resides; Building [cmn_building] table.

calendar_integration.description: Calendar application that the contact uses.

city.description: City in which the contact resides.

company.description: Sys_id of the company record to which the contact is associated; Company [core_company] table.

cost_center.description: Sys_id of the cost center associated with the contact; Cost Center [cmn_cost_center] table.

country.description: Country code of the country in which the contact resides.

date_format.description: Format in which to display dates to contacts.

default_perspective.description: Sys_id of the default perspective for the contact. Located in the Menu List [sys_perspective] table.

department.description: Sys_id of the department associated with the contact. Located in the Department [cmn_department] table.

edu_status.description: Education status of the associated contact.

enable_multifactor_authn.description: Flag that indicates whether multifactor authorization is required for the contact to log in to the service portal.

failed_attempts.description: Number of failed log in attempts.

geolocation_tracked.description: Flag that indicates whether the contact location is obtained through geotracking.
possible_values: true: Contact location obtained through geotracking
false: Contact location not obtained through geotracking

internal_integration_user.description: Flag that indicates whether the contact is an internal integration user.

last_login_device.description: Device the consumer used the last time they logged in to the system.

last_login_time.description: Date and time the contact logged in to the system.

ldap_server.description: Sys_id of the LDAP server used by the contact to last log in to the system; LDAP Server [ldap_server_config] table.

location.description: Sys_id of the record that describes the location of the contact; Location [cmn_location] table.

locked_out.description: Flag that indicates if the contact is locked-out.

manager.description: Sys_id of the record that describes the direct supervisor of the contact; User [sys_user] table.

notification.description: Indicates whether the contact should receive notifications.

on_schedule.description: Indicates the timeliness of dispatched service personnel.
valid_values: behind_less30: Behind schedule, but less than 30 minutes.
behind_30to60: Behind schedule between 30 and 60 minutes.
behind_more60: Behind schedule more than 60 minutes.

preferred_language.description: Country code of the contact primary language.

roles.description: List of user roles associated with the contact.

schedule.description: Sys_id of the record that describes the work schedule for the associated contact; Schedule [cmn_schedule] table.

social_channel.description: Social media channel to which the contact is associated such as Twitter, Facebook, or Instagram.

social_handle.description: User handle on the social media channel.

social_handle_url.description: URL to the contact's social channel profile.

state.description: State in which the contact resides.

time_format.description: Format in which to display time.

time_sheet_policy.description: Sys_id of the record that contains the time sheet policy for the associated contact; Time Sheet Policy [time_sheet_policy] table.

time_zone.description: Time zone in which the contact resides, such as Canada/Central or US/Eastern.

title.description: Contact business title such as Manager, Software Developer, or Contractor.

vip.description: Flag that indicates whether the associated contact has VIP status.

web_service_access_only.description: Flag that indicates whether the contact can only access services through the web.
possible_values: false: Access through all available methods

functionality: Installs two or more packages in a single specified batch.

name.description: User specified descriptive name for this batch request.

notes.description: User specified additional notes about the batch install plan.

packages.description: JSON array containing details of each package to install.

packages.id.description: Sys_id of the application or identifier of the plugin to install.

packages.load_demo_data.description: Flag indicating whether demo data should be loaded when installing the package.

packages.notes.description: User specified notes about the package.

packages.requested_customization_version.description: Version of the application customization to the store application or to the scoped ServiceNow plugin to install, such as 1.0.2 or 2.3.

packages.requested_version.description: Version of the package to install, such as 1.0.2 or 2.3. Required if packages.type is set to application; ignored if set to plugin.

packages.type.description: Type of package. Valid values: application, plugin.

example_code: curl 'instance.servicenow.com/api/sn_cicd/app/batch/install' --request POST --header 'Accept: application/json' --user 'username':'password' --data '{ "name": "Release 2.2 Deployment", "packages": [ { "id": "syd_id_abcefghi", "type": "application", "load_demo_data": false, "requested_version": "1.0.2", "notes": "User specific text to describe this application install" }, { "id": "syd_id_defabcde", "type": "application", "requested_version": "1.0.0", "requested_customization_version": "2.0.7", "notes": "Customization for CSM App1" }, { "id": "com.glide.some.plugin", "type": "plugin", "load_demo_data": true, "notes": "Plugin related notes" } ] }'

functionality: Installs the specified application from the application repository onto the instance making the endpoint call.

sys_id.description: Sys_id of the application to install. You can locate this value in the Sys ID field in the Custom Application [sys_app] table or Store Application [sys_store_app] table.

auto_upgrade_base_app.description: Flag that indicates whether the associated base application should be automatically upgraded to a later version. Valid values: true: Automatically upgrade the associated base application. false: Leave the base application as the version currently installed on the instance.

base_app_version.description: Version of the base application to install. A base application is any third-party application that is available in the ServiceNow Store. If the application has no application customizations, or if the application has application customizations and you are only updating the base application, then enter the updated version of the application in this parameter.

scope.description: Scope name of the application, such as x_aah_custom_app. You can locate this value in the scope field in the Custom Application [sys_app] table or Store Application [sys_store_app] table.

version.description: Version of the application to install.

auto_upgrade_base_app.description: Flag that indicates whether the system should auto-upgrade the base application to a later version if the latest commit on the Git repository is built on a version that is later than that of the base application that is currently installed on the local instance.

mid_server_sys_id.description: Sys_id of the MID server to use for source control operations for this application.

functionality: Invokes Computer Telephony Integration (CTI) operations using a specified operation handlers within the Cloud Call Center framework.
example_code: curl -X POST 'https://instance.servicenow.com/api/sn_cti_core/cti_api/providers/c4b12aa6e700001034b36584c2f6a9bc/components/sn_aws_connect_lambda_proxy_component/versions/v1.0' -H 'Accept: application/json' -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -u 'username':'password' -d '{ "context": { "callbackWaitsForEmptyEventLoop": true, "functionVersion": "$LATEST", "functionName": "snRALJNLambda", "memoryLimitInMB": "128", "logGroupName": "/aws/lambda/snRALJNLambda", "logStreamName": "2020/09/24/[$LATEST]b604a9579ef548a1b3f6b6739d19e1d9", "invokedFunctionArn": "arn:aws:lambda:us-west-2:028738656045:function:snRALJNLambda", "awsRequestId": "b528a5a8-bb0b-4ec8-8e76-aa568f68fdc8" }, "event": { "Details": { "ContactData": { "Attributes": { "$accepted_terms": "true" }, "Channel": "VOICE", "ContactId": "8fe7c107-78df-4eec-85b3-91c6dcb8e912", "CustomerEndpoint": { "Address": "+16693504374", "Type": "TELEPHONE_NUMBER" }, "Description": null, "InitialContactId": "8fe7c107-78df-4eec-85b3-91c6dcb8e912", "InitiationMethod": "INBOUND", "InstanceARN": "arn:aws:connect:us-west-2:028738656045:instance/d276bd83-6305-4f63-abee-e66fd5bdf503", "LanguageCode": "en-US", "MediaStreams": { "Customer": { "Audio": null } }, "Name": null, "PreviousContactId": "8fe7c107-78df-4eec-85b3-91c6dcb8e912", "Queue": { "ARN": "arn:aws:connect:us-west-2:028738656045:instance/d276bd83-6305-4f63-abee-e66fd5bdf503/queue/0f17b62d-d493-439a-88c6-42db0d0e652f", "Name": "BasicQueue", "OutboundCallerId": { "Address": "+18335441399", "Type": "TELEPHONE_NUMBER" } }, "References": {}, "SystemEndpoint": { "Address": "+18335441399", "Type": "TELEPHONE_NUMBER" } }, "Parameters": { "sn_component": "sn_aws_connect_lambda_proxy_component", "sn_operation": "interactionEvent" } }, "Name": "ContactFlowEvent" } }'

api_call: servicenow.get_devops_orchestration_step_mapping(api_version, branchName, isMultiBranch, parentStageName, parentStageURL, orchestrationTaskName, orchestrationTaskURL, testConnection, toolId, toolType)

api_version.description: Optional. Version of the endpoint to access. For example, v1 or v2. Only specify this value to use an endpoint version other than the latest.

branchName.description: Name of the branch associated with the orchestration task.

isMultiBranch.description: If the orchestration tool is Jenkins, flag that indicates whether the project is of type Multibranch. Valid values: true or false. Default: false.

parentStageName.description: If the orchestration task is a child nested inside a parent orchestration task, the name of the parent orchestration task.

parentStageURL.description: If the orchestration task is a child nested inside a parent orchestration task, the URL of the parent orchestration task.

orchestrationTaskName.description: Required. Name of the orchestration task.

orchestrationTaskURL.description: Required. URL of the orchestration task. Must be percent (%) encoded.

testConnection.description: Flag that indicates whether to test the end-to-end connection between the instance and the DevOps tool. Valid values: true or false. Default: false.

toolId.description: Required. Sys_id of the orchestration tool.

toolType.description: Required. Type of tool. Valid value: jenkins.

functionality: Verifies that the information being passed is valid for the creation of an orchestration task and is valid for association to a previously created step.

resource.description: Type of resource schema to return. Valid values: app, version, work_item.

functionality: Returns the schema object for a specific plan: app, version, or work item.

functionality: Enables orchestration tools to register artifacts into a ServiceNow instance.

api_call: servicenow.create_devops_onboarding_app(api_version, apps, pipelines, repositories, plans, artifact_repositories, credentials)

api_version.description: Optional. Version of the endpoint to access. For example, v1 or v2. Only specify this value to use an endpoint version other than the latest.

apps.description: Array of objects that define the apps to create within the associated ServiceNow instance.

bussinessApp.description: Name of the cmdb_ci_business_app to which map the application. This ties the DevOps application to the specified CMDB application.

name.description: Required. User friendly name of the application to create to create. An app is a DevOps product container object that ties plans, repositories, and pipelines together.

credentials.description: Required. Credentials to use for the webhook creation. The created webhook is used by the tool to send notifications.

name.description: Required. ServiceNow user ID of the user making the endpoint request. Located in the User [sys_user] table. This user must have the devops.integration.user role. Starting with version 1.34.1, this user must have the sn_devops.admin role.

password.description: Required. Password of the user specified in the credenitals.name parameter.

pipelines.description: Array of objects that define pipelines to associate with applications.

app.description: Required if a pipelines object is specified. Name of the application to associate with the plan specified in the pipelines.name parameter. The application must have already been created or be specified in the apps object of this request.

name.description: Required if a pipelines object is specified. Name of the pipeline to associate with the application specified in pipelines.app parameter. This pipeline must already be discovered on the ServiceNow instance.

tool.description: Required if a pipelines object is specified. Tool to associate with the pipeline to create a unique pipeline/tool identifier.

changeSteps.description: Array of objects that define the change steps to create for the pipeline specified in the pipelines.name field.

changeApprovalGroup.description: Required if a changeSteps object is specified. Name of the change approval group to associate with the pipeline. Located in the Group [sys_user_group] table. This group must already exist on the ServiceNow instance.

changeControlledBranches.description: Comma-separated list of code branches that are under change control. This only applies for multi branch support.

changeType.description: Required if a changeSteps object is specified. Type of change request to create. The available types are defined in the Type field of the Change Request [change_request] table.

name.description: Required if a changeSteps object is specified. Name of the step to create. The step name must match the name of the corresponding step in the orchestration tool’s pipeline.

type.description: Required if a changeSteps object is specified. Type of step to create. The available step types are defined in the Type field of the Steps [sn_devops_step] table.

plans.description: Array of objects that define a plan to associate with an application.

app.description: Required if a plans object is specified. Names of applications to associate with the plan specified in the plans.name parameter. These applications must have already been created or be specified in the apps object of this request.

name.description: Required if a plans object is specified. Name of the plan to associate with the application specified in plans.app parameter. This plan must already be discovered on the ServiceNow instance.

tool.description: Required if a plans object is specified. Tool to associate with the plan to create a unique plan/tool identifier.

project.description: Required if a plans object is specified and the plans.tool supports projects entity (for example, the ADO tool). Tool to associate with the pipeline to create a unique plans/tool identifier. Parameter value must derive from a project in the Project [sn_devops_project] table.

repositories.description: Array of objects that define the repositories associated with an application. If the repositories object contains an app parameter, then it maps the repository to the application.

app.description: Required if a repositories object is specified. Name of the application to associate with this repository. The application must have already been created or be specified in the apps object of this request.

name.description: Required if a repositories object is specified. Name of the repository to associate with the application specified in repositories.app parameter. This repository must already be discovered on the ServiceNow instance.

tool.description: Required if a repositories object is specified. User friendly tool name to associate with the repository to create a unique repository/tool identifier. The tool must already be created on the ServiceNow instance.

project.description: Required if a repositories object is specified and the repositories.tool supports a projects entity (for example, the ADO tool). Tool to associate with the repositories to create a unique repository/tool identifier. Parameter value must derive from a project in the Project [sn_devops_project] table.

artifact_repositories.description: Array of objects that define artifact repositories associated with applications.

app.description: Required if the artifactRepositories object is specified. Name of the application to associate with this artifactRepositories. The application must have already been created or be specified in the apps object of this request.

name.description: Required if the artifactRepositories object is specified. Name of the artifactRepositories to associate with the application specified in artifactRepositories.app parameter. This artifactRepositories must already be discovered on the ServiceNow instance.

tool.description: Required if the artifactRepositories object is specified. User friendly tool name to associate with the artifactRepositories to create a unique artifactRepositories /tool identifier. The tool must already be created on the ServiceNow instance.

project.description: Required if the artifactRepositories object is specified and the repositories.tool supports projects entity (for example, the ADO tool). Tool to associate with the artifactRepositories to create a unique pipeline/tool identifier.

functionality: Creates an onboarding app event that is asynchronously processed by the DevOps service.

api_version.description: Optional. Version of the endpoint to access. For example, v1 or v2. Only specify this value to use an endpoint version other than the latest.

credentials.description: Required. Credentials to use for the webhook creation. The tool uses the created webhook to send notifications.

name.description: Required. ServiceNow identifier of the user making the endpoint request. Located in the User [sys_user] table. This user must have the devops.integration.user role. Starting with version 1.34.1, this user must have the sn_devops.admin role.

password.description: Required. Password of the user specified in the credenitals.name parameter.

tools.description: Required. Array of objects that define the tools to create within the associated ServiceNow instance. You can create one or more tools in a single request.

name.description: Required. User friendly name or label of the tool to create. This name is used to identify the tool in the DevOps service.

password.description: Required except for Agile tool. Password to use to access the tool. Supported authentications are basic and token; OAuth is not supported.

type.description: Required. Type of tool to create, such as GitHub or BitBucket. The specified value must be one of the Tool labels in the Tool Integrations [sn_devops_tool_integration] table.

useMidServer.description: Flag that indicates whether the tool connects through a MID Server. Valid values: true (Connects through a MID Server), false (Does not connect through a MID Server).

username.description: Required except for Agile tool. User name to use to access the tool through this endpoint.

url.description: Required except for Agile tool. URL of the tool to create. The DevOps service uses this URL to integrate with the tool.

functionality: Creates an onboarding tool event that is asynchronously processed by the DevOps service.
example_code: curl -X POST "https://servicenow-instance/api/sn_devops/v1/devops/onboarding/tool" -H "Accept: application/json" -H "Content-Type: application/json" -u "username":"password" -d '{"tools":[{"name": "Primary GitHub","type": "GitHub","url": "https://api.github.com","username": "username","password": "password","useMidServer": false }],"credentials" : {"name": "devops_user","password": "devops_password"}}'

api_version.description: Optional. Version of the endpoint to access. For example, v1 or v2. Only specify this value to use an endpoint version other than the latest.

tool_id.description: Required. Sys_id of the DevOps tool for which to place the specified task under change control. Located in the Orchestration Tool sn_devops_orchestration_tool table.

tool_type.description: Type of tool. Valid value: Any value that identifies the tool, such as 'jenkins'.

request_body.description: Request body parameters for registering a callback with a ServiceNow instance for an orchestration task under change control.

callbackURL.description: Required. URL that the ServiceNow instance can call back once the associated change request approval process is complete. This callback should let the pipeline execution continue or not, based on the approval result.

changeRequestDetails.description: Name-value pairs of the fields to set when closing a change request.

isMultiBranch.description: If the orchestration tool is Jenkins, flag that indicates whether the project is of type Multibranch.

triggerType.description: Required. The way the orchestration task was started.

upstreamTaskExecutionURL.description: Required if triggerType is set to upstream. Upstream task execution URL.

orchestrationTaskURL.description: Required. URL of the orchestration task for which to create the call back.

parentNode.description: If the orchestration task is a child nested inside a parent orchestration task, this value contains the parent node details.

parentStageName.description: If the orchestration task is a child nested inside a parent orchestration task, the name of the parent orchestration task.

parentStageURL.description: If the orchestration task is a child nested inside a parent orchestration task, the URL of the parent orchestration task.

functionality: Registers a callback with a ServiceNow instance for an orchestration task under change control.
example_code: curl -X POST 'https://instance.servicenow.com/api/sn_devops/v1/devops/orchestration/changeControl?toolId=f0ca45679323008b52f3b457415ae6&toolType=jenkins' -H 'accept: application/json' -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -u 'username:password' -d '{"orchestrationTaskURL":"https://jenkins.mycompany.com:8080/orchestration task/Mobile-Platform-deploy/","callbackURL":"https://jenkins.mycompany.com:8080/sn-devops/964aca59-0cae-4d9b-a36d-5929f426cf31","orchestrationTaskDetails":{"message":"Started by upstream project \"Mobile-Platform-test\" build number 40","triggerType":"upstream","upstreamTaskExecutionURL":"https://jenkins.mycompany.com:8080/job/Mobile-Platform-test/40/"}}'

api_version.description: Optional. Version of the endpoint to access. For example, v1 or v2. Only specify this value to use an endpoint version other than the latest.

tool_id.description: Required. Sys_id of the orchestration tool. Located in the Orchestration Tool [sn_devops_orchestration_tool] table.

tool_type.description: Required. Type of tool. Valid values: jenkins

request_body.description: Request body parameters for verifying and creating an orchestration task.

branchName.description: Name of the branch associated with the orchestration task.

isMultiBranch.description: If the orchestration tool is Jenkins, flag that indicates whether the project is of type Multibranch.

parentNode.description: If the orchestration task is a child nested inside a parent orchestration task, this value contains the parent node details.

parentStageName.description: If the orchestration task is a child nested inside a parent orchestration task, the name of the parent orchestration task.

parentStageURL.description: If the orchestration task is a child nested inside a parent orchestration task, the URL of the parent orchestration task.

orchestrationTaskName.description: Required. Name of the orchestration task. This is the same task referenced in the orchestrationTaskURL.

orchestrationTaskURL.description: Required. URL of the orchestration task.

functionality: Verifies that the information being passed is valid for the creation of an orchestration task and is valid for association to a previously created step. If both are valid, it creates the orchestration task and makes the association.

api_version.description: Optional. Version of the endpoint to access. For example, v1 or v2. Only specify this value to use an endpoint version other than the latest.

orchestration_tool_id.description: Required. Sys_id of the orchestration tool associated with the artifact package. Located in the Orchestration Tool [sn_devops_orchestration_tool] table.

artifact_tool_id.description: Sys_id of the artifact tool associated with the artifact package. Located in the Artifact Tool [sn_devops_artifact_tool] table.

request_body.description: Request body parameters for registering an artifact package.

name.description: Required. Name of package.

artifacts.description: At least one entry required. Array of objects in which each object uniquely identifies an artifact version to include in the package.

branchName.description: Name of the branch associated with the artifact version.

name.description: Required. Artifact file name.

functionality: Enables orchestration tools to create new artifact packages that contain specified artifact versions.

api_version.description: Optional. Version of the endpoint to access.

capability.description: Type of tool passing in the payload to store in the Inbound Event table.

tool_id.description: Required. Sys_id of the tool for which the endpoint is being called.

request_body.description: Request body parameters specific to the tool.

functionality: Posts the passed-in payload to the Inbound Event table for processing by a custom DevOps subflow.

api_version.description: Optional. Version of the endpoint to access.

sn_tool_id.description: Sys_id of the tool to use for the request.

request_body.description: Request body parameters specific to the tool. The payload can be located in the tool under the webhook information.

functionality: Posts the passed-in payload from GitHub, Jira, or Bitbucket to the Events [sn_devops_event] table for processing by a pre-built subflow.

api_version.description: Optional. Version of the endpoint to access.

changeControlId.description: Sys_id of the change control task.

toolId.description: Sys_id of the DevOps tool associated with the change control task.

request_body.description: Request body parameters for updating the change control task.

functionality: Updates the change control information for the specified orchestration task.
example_code: curl -X PUT 'https://instance.service-now.com/api/sn_devops/v1/devops/orchestration/change/f0ca45679323008b52f3b457415ae6?toolId=f0ca45679323008b52f3b457415ae6' -H 'accept: application/json' -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -u 'username:password' -d '{"orchestrationTaskURL":"https://jenkins.mycompany.com:8080/job/Mobile-Platform-deploy/","toolType":"jenkins","callbackURL":"https://jenkins.mycompany.com:8080/sn-devops/964aca59-0cae-4d9b-a36d-5929f426cf31","orchestrationTaskDetails":{"message":"Started by upstream project \"Mobile-Platform-test\" build number 40","triggerType":"upstream","upstreamTaskExecutionURL":"https://jenkins.mycompany.com:8080/job/Mobile-Platform-test/40/"}}'

api_version.description: Optional. Version of the endpoint to access.

changeInfo.description: The identifier for the change information.

changeRequestNumber.description: Change request number associated with the orchestration task to update.

request_body.description: Name-value pairs for the field(s) to update in the associated change request.

functionality: Updates fields in a specified change request.
example_code: curl -X PUT 'https://instance.servicenow.com/api/sn_devops/v1/devops/orchestration/changeInfo?changeRequestNumber=CHG0030023' -H 'accept: application/json' -u 'username:password' -d '{"short_description": "Test description", "priority": "1", "start_date": "2021-02-05 08:00:00", "end_date": "2022-04-05 08:00:00", "justification": "test justification", "description": "test description", "cab_required": true, "comments": "This update for work notes is from jenkins file", "work_notes": "test work notes", "assignment_group": "a715cd759f2002002920bde8132e7018" }'

api_version.description: Optional. Version of the endpoint to access.

appid.description: Sys_id of the application to delete.

functionality: Deletes an application.
questions: What precautions should be taken before deleting an application?

api_version.description: Optional. Version of the endpoint to access.

appid.description: Sys_id of the application to retrieve.

functionality: Retrieves an application.

api_version.description: Optional. Version of the endpoint to access.

appid.description: Sys_id of the application to update.

appManagedByGroups.description: Comma-separated list of sys_ids of the groups that manage the application.

appModelOwnerId.description: Sys_id of the application model owner.

functionality: Updates an application.
example_code: curl 'https://instance.service-now.com/api/sn_devops_config/devops_config/application/38e17dc3473d111072566862736d43c7' --request PATCH --header 'Accept:application/json' --header 'Content-Type:application/json' --data '{ "appDescription": "Updated description of Demo Application created from REST API", "appManufacturerId": "262702654725d950a34a3085d36d435e", "appModelOwnerId": "6816f79cc0a8016401c5a33be04be441" }' --user 'username':'password'

api_call: servicenow.create_devops_application(api_version, appDescription, appManagedByGroups, appManufacturerId, appModelId, appModelName, appModelOwnerId, appName, appServiceId, appServiceName, technicalServiceId, type)

api_version.description: Optional. Version of the endpoint to access.

appManagedByGroups.description: Comma-separated list of sys_ids of the groups that manage the application.

appModelId.description: Sys_id of an existing application model to use to create the application.

appModelName.description: Name of an existing application model to use to create the application.

appModelOwnerId.description: Sys_id of the application model owner.

appName.description: Name of the application.

appServiceId.description: Sys_id of an existing application service to use to create the application.

appServiceName.description: Name of an existing application service to use to create the application.

technicalServiceId.description: Sys_id of an existing dynamic CI group to use to create the application.

type.description: The type of application to create.

functionality: Creates an application.
example_code: curl 'https://instance.service-now.com/api/sn_devops_config/devops_config/application' --request POST --header 'Accept:application/json' --header 'Content-Type:application/json' --data '{ "type": "application", "appName": "Demo Application 1234", "appDescription": "Description of Demo Application created from REST API", "appManufacturerId": "262702654725d950a34a3085d36d435e", "appModelOwnerId": "6816f79cc0a8016401c5a33be04be441" }' --user 'username':'password'

api_version.description: Optional. Version of the endpoint to access.

id.description: Sys_id of the email for which to return details.

sysparm_fields.description: Comma-separated list of fields to return in the response.

functionality: Returns the email details for the specified email record.

api_version.description: Optional. Version of the endpoint to access.

email_data.description: Data related to the email to be created.

functionality: Creates an email record using the passed information.

api_version.description: Optional. Version of the endpoint to access.

id.description: Sys_id of the entitlement record to retrieve.

display_value.description: Type of data to return. Valid values: false, true, all.

functionality: Returns the specified entitlement record, its associated coverage, and its latest usage details.

api_version.description: Optional. Version of the endpoint to access.

request_body.description: JSON object containing the details of the entitlement record to be created.

functionality: Creates an entitlement record and all its related detail records.

api_version.description: Optional. Version of the endpoint to access.

contentQuery.description: Filter to apply to the payload of the event. This query is a deeper event filter that is used to find information such as event severity or ticket type.

externalId.description: Unique external identifier for the topic, such as a GUID.

headerQuery.description: Filter to apply to the event header properties. This query defines the type of events to listen to for the associated topic.

name.description: Name of the topic.

namespace.description: Namespace for the topic. Empty if there is no associated namespace.

functionality: Creates a new record in the Topic table and saves the passed topic information to that record.

api_name: Event Notification Management Open API - POST /{instance_name}/{scope_id}/{GUID}

event.description: Details about the event that occurred.

affectedService.description: List of objects identifying one or more services affected by the alarm.

href.description: URL reference providing details of the affected service.

id.description: Identifier of the service affected by the alarm. This value maps to the affected configuration item (CI) on the alert.

href.description: URL reference to get the details of the alarm object.

id.description: Unique identifier of the alarm object. This value maps to a CI in the system.

alarmType.description: Type of alarm. Used to categorize the alarm.

thresholdId.description: Unique identifier of the threshold that caused the alarm.

externalAlarmId.description: Unique identifier for the alarm from the source system posting the alarm.

id.description: Unique identifier of the alarm. Specified by the alarm owning system.

perceivedSeverity.description: Possible severities associated with the alarm.

probableCause.description: Most likely situation to trigger the alarm. Use with alarmType to qualify the alarm.

sourceSystemId.description: Unique identifier of the source system of the alarm.

specificProblem.description: Specific problem that triggers the alarm. Use with probableCause to qualify the alarm.

functionality: Places the payload of the associated request in the NowMQ queue.
example_code: curl -X POST 'https://example.com/api/notification' -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -d '{"eventType":"AlarmCreateNotification","event":{"alarm":{"id":"","externalAlarmId":"ext123456","alarmType":"QualityOfServiceAlarm","perceivedSeverity":"MINOR","alarmedObject":{"id":"vManage_000000","href":"http://api/alarmedobject/000000"},"probableCause":"Threshold crossed","sourceSystemId":"SOURCE_SYSTEM_vManage_00000_000_00","href":"http://api/alarm/ROUTER_IF@Cisco-0000-0-0-0-0-00-00-0--Xz0/00@00","specificProblem":"Inbound Traffic threshold crossed","crossedThresholdInformation":{"thresholdId":"12fasdfasdfasd"},"affectedService":[{"id":"SD WAN Enterprise Solutions","href":"http://api/service/vlan_dot0_dot0"}]}}}'

schema_table_name.description: The name of the external content schema table that defines the schema for the indexed documents to delete. For example, u_ext_content.

query.description: A valid URL-escaped query for the schema table specified by schema_table_name. For example, title=Introduction to query for documents whose title is Introduction.

functionality: Deletes all external documents that match the specified query from the AI Search index.

schema_table_name.description: The name of the external content schema table that defines the schema for the indexed document to delete. For example, u_ext_content.

document_id.description: The unique identifier for the external document to delete. For example, ADMIN-2027858531-16.

functionality: Deletes the external document with a specified unique identifier from the AI Search index.

schema_table_name.description: The name of the external content schema table that defines the schema for external documents in the request. For example, u_ext_content.

documents.description: An array of objects representing external documents to ingest for indexing.

document_id.description: Unique identifier for the external document in the external content schema table specified by the schema_table_name path parameter.

content_pointer.description: Identifier for an instance of binary content stored using the POST /ais/external_content/storeContent endpoint. During ingestion, AI Search parses the binary content and adds its searchable content to the indexed record that represents the external document.

principals.description: Object containing key-value pairs that describe the external document's access permissions for externally defined security principals (users and groups).

principals.everyone.description: Flag that indicates whether access to the external document is allowed for all users.

principals.groups.deny.description: Array of strings where each string is the name of an externally defined group that is denied access to the external document.

principals.groups.read.description: Array of strings where each string is the name of an externally defined group that is allowed to access the external document.

principals.none.description: Boolean option indicating whether access to the external document is denied for all users.

principals.users.deny.description: Array of strings where each string is the name of an externally defined user that is denied access to the external document.

principals.users.read.description: Array of strings where each string is the name of an externally defined user that is allowed to access the external document.

properties.description: Object containing name-value pairs where each pair represents a field name and value to ingest for the document.

example_code: curl 'https://instance.servicenow.com/api/now/v2/ais/external_content/ingestDocument/u_ext_content' --request POST --user 'username':'password' --header 'Accept: application/json' --header 'Content-Type: application/json' --data '[{"document_id":"ADMIN-2027858531-16","content_pointer":"749b52a1-baa8-4556-a4f3-00404c95e6a8","properties":{"title":"Introduction","url":"file:///myhost/reports/Introduction.pdf","file_name":"Introduction.pdf","file_size":"10285","creation_date":"2020-11-01 12:27:43"},"principals":{"everyone":false,"groups.read":["report-users","report-admins"],"users.deny":["ad\abel-tuter"]}},{"document_id":"ADMIN-2587918521-27","content_pointer":"bd605435-268b-464f-a7c3-0c5ea894a5c2","properties":{"title":"Report for 31 August 2020","url":"file:///myhost/reports/Report-2020-08-31.pdf","file_size":"27597","creation_date":"2020-09-01 12:48:13"},"principals":{"everyone":false,"groups.read":["report-users","report-admins"],"users.read":["ad\beth-anglin"]}}]'
functionality: Sends a list of external documents to the AI Search ingestion batcher for indexing. After indexing completes, content from the ingested documents becomes searchable.

api_name: External Content Ingestion API - POST ais/external_content/storeContent

binary_data.description: Binary content to store as a content object in AI Search.

functionality: Stores binary content as a content object in AI Search.
questions: What are the valid values for the 'Content-Type' request header?
What response status code indicates a successful request to store binary content?
How does AI Search associate stored binary content with an external document?

employee_identifier.description: Unique identifier of an employee. The calling system generates this value and can be in whatever format is consistent with their system. To obtain this value, first call the endpoint using the updated_after parameter.

sysparm_limit.description: Maximum number of records to return. For requests that exceed this number of records, use the sysparm_offset parameter to paginate record retrieval.

sysparm_offset.description: Starting record index for which to begin retrieving records. Use this value to paginate record retrieval. This functionality enables the retrieval of all records, regardless of the number of records, in small manageable chunks.

updated_after.description: Date to use to determine the employee data to return. All United States-based employees (work or home) that were added to your instance, or whose information was updated on or after this date, are included in the return results.
updated_after.format: YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS or YYYY-MM-DD (time defaults to 00:00:00)

functionality: Returns employee profile information for employees based in the United States.

items.description: Array of objects in which each object describes a CI to create or update.

structure.className: Required. The sys_class_name (class/table name) of the CI to create or update. This value can be any CMDB table, such as cmdb_ci_linux_server or cmdb_ci_win_server.
structure.internal_id: Unique identifier for this item in this payload. Can be any value, but must be unique within the payload.

lookup.description: Array of objects in which each object describes a lookup-based identification record.

structure.className: Required. The sys_class_name or class/table name of the CI to create or update.
structure.internal_id: Unique identifier for this lookup record in this payload.

sys_object_source_info.source_feed: Name that uniquely identifies the feed sending this CI.
sys_object_source_info.source_name: Data source for the CI information.
sys_object_source_info.source_native_key: Unique key/id from the source for the CI.
sys_object_source_info.source_recency_timestamp: UTC date and time that the CI was scanned. Format: YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss

structure.values: Object describing fields for this lookup item as name/value pairs.

related.description: Array of objects in which each object describes an item record to create or update, based on a related table.

structure.className: Required. The sys_class_name or class/table name of the related item to create or update.
structure.internal_id: Unique identifier for this related item in this payload.

sys_object_source_info.source_feed: Name that uniquely identifies the feed sending this related item.
sys_object_source_info.source_name: Data source for the related item information.
sys_object_source_info.source_native_key: Unique key/id from the source for the related item.
sys_object_source_info.source_recency_timestamp: UTC date and time that the related item was scanned. Format: YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss

structure.values: Object describing fields to create or update for this related item as name/value pairs.

settings.skipReclassificationRestrictionRules: Flag that indicates whether IRE should skip running the Reclassification Restriction rule that matches the class for the payload item. Valid values: true: Skip running the rule. false: Run the rule. Default: false
settings.updateWithoutDowngrade: Indicates whether update and downgrade are both permitted for this CI. Valid values: true: Update the item but downgrade is not permitted. false: Both item update and downgrade are permitted. Default: false
settings.updateWithoutSwitch: Indicates whether this CI can be updated and its class switched. Valid values: true: Update the item but class switching is not permitted. false: Both item update and class switching are permitted. Default: false
settings.updateWithoutUpgrade: Indicates whether update and upgrade are both permitted for this CI. Valid values: true: Update the item but upgrade is not permitted. false: Both item update and upgrade are permitted. Default: false

sys_object_source_info.source_feed: Name that uniquely identifies the feed sending this CI.
sys_object_source_info.source_name: Data source for the CI information.
sys_object_source_info.source_native_key: Unique key/id from the source for the CI.
sys_object_source_info.source_recency_timestamp: UTC date and time that the CI was scanned. Format: YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss

structure.values: Object describing fields to create or update for this CI as name/value pairs.

referenceItems.description: Array of objects in which each object describes a reference between two items in the payload.

structure.referenced: The internal_id defined for the item being referenced by another item.
structure.referencedBy: The internal_id defined for the item that references another item.
structure.referenceField: Name of the reference field in the class/table for the referencedBy item.

relations.description: Array of objects in which each object describes a relationship between two items defined in the payload.

structure.child: The integer index of the CI object in the items array that represents the child in the relationship.
structure.child_id: The internal_id of the child item in the relationship.
structure.parent: The integer index of the CI object in the items array that represents the parent in the relationship.
structure.parent_id: The internal_id of the parent item in the relationship.

sys_rel_source_info.source_feed: Any string that is a sub-discovery/scan within the discovery source.

structure.type: The type of relationship existing between the parent and child items.

functionality: Inserts or updates configuration items (CIs) in the CMDB by applying identification and reconciliation rules to the specified payload.
curl_command: curl 'https://instance.servicenow.com/api/now/identifyreconcile' --request POST --header 'Accept: application/json' --header 'Content-Type: application/json' --user 'username:password' --data '{ "items": [{ "className": "cmdb_ci_linux_server", "values": { "sys_class_name": "cmdb_ci_linux_server", "name": "lnux101", "host_name": "lnux101.servicenow.com", "ip_address": "10.11.12.173", "os_name": "Linux Red Hat" }, "lookup": [{ "className": "cmdb_serial_number", "values": { "serial_number": "lnux101", "serial_number_type": "uuid", "valid": "true" } }, { "className": "cmdb_ci_network_adapter", "values": { "name": "eth0", "ip_address": "10.11.12.173", "mac_address": "00:55:51:21:26:2f" } }] }, { "className": "cmdb_ci_ip_switch", "values": { "name": "IP-Switch-1", "serial_number": "Switch23587", "serial_number_type": "uuid" } }], "relations": [{ "parent": 0, "child": 1, "type": "IP Connection::IP Connection" }] }'

api_version.description: Optional. Version of the endpoint to access.

options.description: Comma-separated list of name-value pairs representing Enhanced IRE options applied for the request.

sysparm_data_source.description: Identifies the source of the CI information.

items.description: Array of objects describing configuration items (CIs) to create or update.

referenceItems.description: Array of objects describing references between items in the payload.

relations.description: Array of objects describing relationships between items defined in the payload.

functionality: Inserts or updates CIs in the CMDB by applying identification and reconciliation rules to the payload.

api_version.description: Optional. Version of the endpoint to access.

sysparm_data_source.description: Identifies the source of the CI information.

items.description: Array of objects describing configuration items (CIs) to simulate creating or updating.

referenceItems.description: Array of objects describing references between items in the payload.

relations.description: Array of objects describing relationships between items defined in the payload.

functionality: Simulates the CMDB operation (insert/update) without committing the operations in the database.
example_code:
curl "https://instance.servicenow.com/api/now/identifyreconcile/query" \ 
--request POST \ 
--header "Accept: application/json" \ 
--header "Content-Type: application/json" \ 
--user "username":"password" \ 
--data '{ \ 
  "items": [{ \ 
    "className": "cmdb_ci_linux_server", \ 
    "values": { \ 
      "sys_class_name": "cmdb_ci_linux_server", \ 
      "name": "lnux101", \ 
      "host_name": "lnux101.servicenow.com", \ 
      "ip_address": "10.11.12.173", \ 
      "os_name": "Linux Red Hat" \ 
    }, \ 
    "lookup": [{ \ 
      "className": "cmdb_serial_number", \ 
      "values": { \ 
        "serial_number": "lnux101", \ 
        "serial_number_type": "uuid", \ 
        "valid": "true" \ 
      } \ 
    }, { \ 
      "className": "cmdb_ci_network_adapter", \ 
      "values": { \ 
        "name": "eth0", \ 
        "ip_address": "10.11.12.173", \ 
        "mac_address": "00:55:51:21:26:2f" \ 
      } \ 
    }] \ 
  }, { \ 
    "className": "cmdb_ci_ip_switch", \ 
    "values": { \ 
      "name": "IP-Switch-1", \ 
      "serial_number": "Switch23587", \ 
      "serial_number_type": "uuid" \ 
    } \ 
  }], \ 
  "relations": [{ \ 
    "parent": 0, \ 
    "child": 1, \ 
    "type": "IP Connection::IP Connection" \ 
  }] \ 
}'

options.description: Comma-separated list of name-value pairs representing Enhanced IRE options applied for the request.

sysparm_data_source.description: Identifies the source of the CI information.

functionality: Determines the CMDB operation to perform with the specified payload.

sys_id.description: Sys_id of the record that contains the data.

functionality: Retrieves the specified import staging record and resulting transformation result.

api_version.description: Version of the API being used.

stagingTableName.description: Name of the table from which to import the data.

request_body_parameters.description: Name-value pairs to insert in the import fields.

functionality: Inserts incoming data into a specified staging table and triggers transformation based on predefined transform maps in the import set table.

api_version.description: Version of the API being used.

stagingTableName.description: Name of the import set table from which to import the data.

multi_import_set_id.description: Sys_id of an entry in the Multi Import Sets [sys_multi_import_set] table. If specified, adds the current import to this multiple import set instead of adding to a new multiple import set.

run_after.description: Sys_id of an entry in the Import Sets [sys_import_set] table. Enables running the current import set after the specified import set is complete. You can use this parameter to enforce the sequential order of imports. This parameter is only valid in asynchronous transformations.

request_body.description: Request body in JSON format containing records to be inserted into the import fields.

functionality: Inserts multiple records into a specified staging table and triggers transformation based on predefined transform maps or Robust Transform Engine (RTE) configurations.

curl "https://instance.service-now.com/api/sn_csm_order_mgmt/order" \
--request POST \
--header "Accept:application/json" \
--header "Content-Type:application/json" \
--data "{
"account": "c480021553ab70101aaeddeeff7b120f",
"contact":"96d0461553ab70101aaeddeeff7b120b",
"order_currency": "USD",
"order_line_items": [
{
"account": "c480021553ab70101aaeddeeff7b120f",
"action": "add",
"contact": "96d0461553ab70101aaeddeeff7b120b",
"list_price": "2000",
"order_line_characteristics": [
{
"characteristic" : "Solana color",
"characteristic_option" : "Stainless steel"
},
{
"characteristic" :"Microvawe Capacity",
"characteristic_option" : "1.2 cu"
}
],
"product_offering": "2d4376760f740110603bf634a7767e46",
"quantity": "1",
"shipping_city": "Santa Clara",
"shipping_country": "USA",
"shipping_state": "CA",
"shipping_street": "222 Star St",
"shipping_zip": "94560",
"state": "draft",
"status": "new",
"total_price": "2000",
"unit_of_measurement": "cb2795d553020110286eddeeff7b12ff",
"unit_price": "2000"
}
]
}" \
--user 'user':'password'

api_call: servicenow.get_scorecards(api_version='v1', sysparm_breakdown='sys_id', sysparm_breakdown_relation='sys_id', sysparm_contains='string', sysparm_display='true', sysparm_display_value='false', sysparm_elements_filter='sys_id', sysparm_exclude_reference_link='false', sysparm_favorites='false', sysparm_from='date', sysparm_include_aggregates='false', sysparm_include_available_aggregates='false', sysparm_include_available_breakdowns='false', sysparm_include_forecast_scores='false', sysparm_include_realtime='false', sysparm_include_score_notes='false', sysparm_include_scores='false', sysparm_include_target_color_scheme='false', sysparm_include_trendline_scores='false', sysparm_key='false', sysparm_limit=10, sysparm_page=1, sysparm_per_page=10, sysparm_sortby='value', sysparm_sortdir='desc', sysparm_step=1, sysparm_tags='sys_id', sysparm_target='false', sysparm_to='date', sysparm_uuid='string')

api_version.description: Version of the endpoint to access, e.g., v1 or v2.

sysparm_breakdown.description: Sys_id of a breakdown to return chart information organized as defined by the breakdown.

sysparm_breakdown_relation.description: Sys_id of a breakdown relation to break down the returned data using that relation.

sysparm_contains.description: Comma-separated list of names or descriptions to return results only from indicators with a matching value.

sysparm_display.description: Flag that indicates the type of indicators to return. Valid values: true, all.

sysparm_display_value.description: Determines the type of data returned, either the actual values from the database or the display values of the fields.

sysparm_elements_filter.description: Sys_id of an elements filter to apply to the returned data.

sysparm_exclude_reference_link.description: Flag that indicates whether to hide additional information provided for reference fields.

sysparm_favorites.description: Flag that indicates whether to return only indicators that are favorites of the querying user.

sysparm_from.description: Earliest date to return scores from. Only scores from this date or later are returned.

sysparm_include_aggregates.description: Flag that indicates whether to return all possible aggregates for an indicator.

sysparm_include_available_aggregates.description: Flag that indicates whether to return all available aggregates for an indicator when no aggregate has been applied.

sysparm_include_available_breakdowns.description: Flag that indicates whether to return all available breakdowns for an indicator.

sysparm_include_forecast_scores.description: Flag that indicates whether to return the forecast_scores element.

sysparm_include_realtime.description: Flag that indicates whether to return the realtime_enabled element.

sysparm_include_score_notes.description: Flag that indicates whether to return all notes associated with the score.

sysparm_include_scores.description: Flag that indicates whether to return indicator scores for the entire time range selected.

sysparm_include_target_color_scheme.description: Flag that indicates whether to return the target_color_scheme element.

sysparm_include_trendline_scores.description: Flag that indicates whether to return the trendline_scores element.

sysparm_key.description: Flag that indicates whether to return results only for key indicators.

sysparm_limit.description: Maximum number of scores to return.

sysparm_per_page.description: Maximum number of indicators each query can return on a page.

sysparm_sortby.description: Value to use when sorting results.

sysparm_step.description: Numeric value to skip scores, based on the indicator frequency.

sysparm_tags.description: Indicator group sys_id in which to return the indicators of that group.

sysparm_target.description: Flag that indicates whether to return results only for indicators that have a target set.

sysparm_to.description: Latest date from which to return scores. Only scores from this date or earlier are returned.

sysparm_uuid.description: Colon-separated list of sys_id values to specify which indicators, breakdowns, aggregates, and domains to query.

api_version.description: Optional. Version of the endpoint to access, e.g., v1 or v2.

account.description: Sys_id of the account record. Required if consumer is not specified.

ends.description: Date the service contract ends. Format: yyyy-mm-dd.

install_base_items_covered.description: List of install base items covered under the service contract.

service_contract_lines.description: List of service contract lines associated with the service contract.

short_description.description: Brief description or name of the service contract.

sold_products_covered.description: List of products covered under the service contract.

starts.description: Date on which the service contract begins. Format: yyyy-mm-dd.

state.description: Current state of the service contract. Valid values: active, cancelled, draft, expired, suspended.

vendor_contract.description: Unique identifier for an associated external contract.

sold_product.description: Sys_id of the sold product record associated with the service contract line.

state.description: Current state of the service contract line. Valid values: active, cancelled, draft, expired, suspended.

limit.description: Maximum number of records to return. Use with offset to paginate record retrieval.
